timeAnchors.definition: The start of the screening/observation period, with Day 1 implicitly following the Day -42 to Day -1 window

repetitions.exitCondition: Completion of 1st year of treatment in Part B
repetitions.sourceText: Samples will be collected at 3-month intervals during the 1st year of treatment in Part B

repetitions.exitCondition: Remainder of the time on study
repetitions.sourceText: then at 6-month intervals for the remainder of the time on study.
Collection of PK samples at predose and 1 hour (±15 minutes) postdose was added.
safety assessments include AEs with onset within 24 hours of infusion was added.

repetitions.exitCondition: 24 months following LPO for Part A
repetitions.sourceText: The Part B open-label extension study will run for 2 years instead of 1 year following last patient out (LPO) under Part A.

mandatoryVisits: End of Study (24 months post-Part A LPO)
traversalConstraints.sourceText: [{'condition': 'Subject at preselected site/country qualifies for home infusion', 'path': ['HOME_INFUSION_QUALIFICATION', 'HOME_INFUSION_ADMINISTRATION', 'SATISFACTION_ASSESSMENT']}, {'condition': 'Immunogenicity monitoring requires follow-up', 'path': ['ADA_TESTING', 'PREDOSE_PD_BACKUP_SAMPLING']}]

executionTypes.rationale: WINDOW signals: 2; EPISODE signals: 1; SINGLE signals: 7; RECURRING signals: 2
WINDOW signals: 2; EPISODE signals: 1; SINGLE signals: 4
Samples are collected at scheduled intervals during the 1st year and then every 6 months.
Assessment occurs at two specific scheduled points: after the first home infusion and after the fourth home infusion.
The protocol introduces additional time points for this panel throughout the Part B extension.
Evaluated as a secondary exploratory objective involving multiple collection time points throughout the study phase.
Study drug administration is a repeated activity throughout the treatment duration.

footnoteConditions.text: f. Height measured at Screening only. Body weight measured every 3 months during Part B.
footnoteConditions.sourceText: f. Height measured at Screening only. Body weight measured every 3 months during Part B.

footnoteConditions.text: g. Vital signs measurements (supine BP, PR, RR, and oral temperature) are to be obtained at Screening and at each subsequent visit.
footnoteConditions.sourceText: g. Vital signs measurements (supine BP, PR, RR, and oral temperature) are to be obtained at Screenin

footnoteConditions.text: h. For a complete list of analytes, see protocol (Section 10.1, Appendix A).
footnoteConditions.sourceText: h. For a complete list of analytes, see protocol (Section 10.1, Appendix A).

footnoteConditions.text: i. BIVV009 doses of 6.5 grams (if <75 kg) or 7.5 grams (if >=75 kg) based on patient's baseline body weight will be administered via IV infusion.

footnoteConditions.text: j. During Part A, PK and PD samples will be collected at predose and 1 hour (+/-15 minutes) postdose.
footnoteConditions.sourceText: j. During Part A, PK and PD samples will be collected at predose and 1 hour (+/-15 minutes) postdose

footnoteConditions.text: k. AEs will be recorded from the time the patient signs the informed consent form until 9 weeks after administration of the last dose of study drug.

footnoteConditions.text: l. To be performed every 3 months.
footnoteConditions.sourceText: l. To be performed every 3 months.

footnoteConditions.text: m. Refer to the Laboratory Manual for details of sample collection during Screening.
footnoteConditions.sourceText: m. Refer to the Laboratory Manual for details of sample collection during Screening.

footnoteConditions.text: n. Samples will be collected for a subset of the disease-related biomarkers at Day 91 only.
footnoteConditions.sourceText: n. Samples will be collected for a subset of the disease-related biomarkers at Day 91 only.

footnoteConditions.text: o. During Part B, a 12-lead ECG will be conducting pre- and postdose at 3 months (Day 273).
footnoteConditions.sourceText: o. During Part B, a 12-lead ECG will be conducting pre- and postdose at 3 months (Day 273).

footnoteConditions.text: p. During Part B, the healthcare resource utilization data will be recorded every 4 weeks.
footnoteConditions.sourceText: p. During Part B, the healthcare resource utilization data will be recorded every 4 weeks.

footnoteConditions.text: q. To be performed in the following order: FACIT-Fatigue first, PGIS second, PGIC third, SF-12 fourth, and EQ-5D-5L fifth.
footnoteConditions.sourceText: q. To be performed in the following order: FACIT-Fatigue first, PGIS second, PGIC third, SF-12 fourt

footnoteConditions.text: s. SLE panel will be performed every 6 months in Part-B of the study.
footnoteConditions.sourceText: s. SLE panel will be performed every 6 months in Part-B of the study.

footnoteConditions.text: t. In Part B, hematology and clinical chemistry panels to be performed every 2 weeks after Week 25 and up to Week 79.

footnoteConditions.text: u. To be performed at 3-month intervals during the 1st year of treatment in Part B, and then at 6-month intervals.

endpointAlgorithms.name: Primary: Efficacy Response (Part A)
endpointAlgorithms.successCriteria: Composite of Hb increase ≥ 1.5 g/dL from baseline, transfusion-free status, and no prohibited medications
endpointAlgorithms.sourceText: The primary endpoint is a composite endpoint of the following: Increase in Hb ≥ 1.5 g/dL from baseline at the treatment assessment visit (Week 26), no blood transfusion from Week 5 through Week 26, an

endpointAlgorithms.name: Secondary: Immunogenicity of BIVV009
endpointAlgorithms.algorithm: Presence of Anti-Drug Antibodies (ADA) at 3-month intervals (Year 1) then 6-month intervals
endpointAlgorithms.successCriteria: Characterization of immunogenicity profile over 2 years
endpointAlgorithms.sourceText: Secondary Exploratory Objective for Part A was added: To evaluate the immunogenicity of BIVV009... Collection of ADA samples during the 1st year of treatment in part B, then every 6 months.

endpointAlgorithms.name: Exploratory: Home Infusion Satisfaction
endpointAlgorithms.algorithm: Assessment of satisfaction scores after 1st and 4th home infusions
endpointAlgorithms.successCriteria: Completion of satisfaction assessment in patients receiving home infusion
endpointAlgorithms.sourceText: Part B Satisfaction with home infusion after first home infusion and after four home infusion will be assessed in patients with home infusion was added.

endpointAlgorithms.name: Safety: Home Infusion Adverse Events
endpointAlgorithms.successCriteria: Identification of AEs occurring within 24 hours of home administration
endpointAlgorithms.sourceText: For patients with home infusions, safety assessments include AEs with onset within 24 hours of infusion was added.

endpointAlgorithms.name: Pharmacokinetics (PK) and Pharmacodynamics (PD)
endpointAlgorithms.algorithm: Measurement at predose and 1 hour (±15 minutes) postdose
endpointAlgorithms.successCriteria: Successful collection of samples at 3-month (Year 1) and 6-month intervals
endpointAlgorithms.sourceText: Collection of PK samples at predose and 1 hour (±15 minutes) postdose was added. Samples will be collected at 3-month intervals during the 1st year of treatment in Part B and then at 6-month intervals

derivedVariables.name: Change from Baseline in Hemoglobin
derivedVariables.baselineDefinition: Last non-missing value prior to the first dose of BIVV009
derivedVariables.analysisWindow: As specified in the Statistical Analysis Plan (SAP)

derivedVariables.name: Fixed Dose Assignment
derivedVariables.derivationRule: If weight < 75 kg then dose = 6.5 g; If weight >= 75 kg then dose = 7.5 g

transitions.trigger: Progress to Part B Extension phase
